question: Given below are two statements. Statement I - At the end of gastric digestion, a semi solid acidic mass called chyle is formed. Statement II - At the end of digestion in small intestine the simple form of nutrients called chyme are formed. In the light of above statements, choose the correct option given below:
question_latex:
Given below are two statements. Statement I - At the end of gastric digestion, a semi solid acidic mass called chyle is formed. 
Statement II - At the end of digestion in small intestine the simple form of nutrients called chyme are 
formed. In the light of above statements, choose the correct option given below:
options: Both statement I and statement II are correct.
Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
answer: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
solution: At the end of gastric digestion, a semi solid acidic mass called chyme is formed. Chyme is formed in the stomach, not small intestine.

Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
answer: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
solution: In the human large intestine, bacterial fermentation of carbohydrates produces hydrogen, carbon dioxide and methane, while protein breakdown yields indole, skatole, and hydrogen sulphide $(H_2 S)$ .

question: From the following, select the INCORRECT statement with reference to absorption of nutrients/substances in human alimentary canal.[MHT-CET 2024]

(B) Vitamin B and Vitamin C are absorbed in the blood capillaries in intestinal villi.
(C) Alcohol and aspirin are absorbed in stomach.
(D) Vitamin A and Vitamin D are absorbed in lacteals of small intestine.
answer: (A) Monosaccharides and amino acids are absorbed in small intestine as well as large intestine.
solution: (A) Monosaccharide & amino acids are absorbed in small intestine as large intestine do not perform any absorption function.

question: Salivary gland present in front of ear is called ______gland.
question_latex: Salivary gland present in front of ear is called \_\_\_\_gland.
solution: There are three pairs of salivary glands around the buccal cavity. Gland present in front of ear is called parotid gland. Sub lingual below the tongue and sub Mandibular is around mandible and maxilla.

question: Which one of the following is NOT a cause of constipation?
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT a cause of constipation?
solution: Avoiding eating large meal, lying down after meal, spicy, oily, junk food, smoking, alcohol are the preventive measures for indigestion.

question: Enamel is made up of ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Enamel is made up of ___ [\text{MHT-CET 2023}]
solution: The crown is covered by the hardest substance of the body called enamel. Enamel is made up of calcium phosphate and calcium carbonate.

question: Brunner's glands are present in the ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Brunner's glands are present in the ___ [\text{MHT-CET 2023}]
solution: Brunner's glands are present in the submucosa of small intestine and they helps in action of goblet cells and mucus secretion.

question: Bile salts _____ fats in duodenum. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Bile salts \underline{\phantom{a}} fats in duodenum. [\text{MHT-CET 2020}]
solution: Bile secretion is given out by liver and released in duodenum. It helps in emulsifying fats and helps in lipid digestion.

question: Given below are two statements: Statement I - Pyloric sphincter prevents back flow of food from stomach to oesophagus. Statement II - Cardiac sphincter regulates flow of food from stomach to small intestine. In the light of above statements, select the correct option given below:[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: \text{Statement I} - \text{Pyloric sphincter prevents back flow of food from stomach to oesophagus.} \text{Statement II} - \text{Cardiac sphincter regulates flow of food from stomach to small intestine.} \text{In the light of above statements, select the correct option given below:[MHT-CET 2024]}
options: Both statement I and statement II are correct.
Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
answer: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
solution: Cardiac sphincter prevents back flow of food from stomach to oesophagus. Pyloric sphincter regulates flow of food from stomach to small intestine.

question: In human alimentary canal, churning of food takes place in ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: In human alimentary canal, churning of food takes place in \underline{\phantom{a}} [\text{MHT-CET 2023}]
solution: In human alimentary canal, churning of food takes place in stomach with help of smooth muscles layers called rugae and in buccal chamber mastication with the help of dentition.

question: Enterokinase plays a role in[MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Enterokinase plays a role in[\text{MHT-CET 2020}]
options: r -formation of fatty acids into chylomicrons
solution: Enterokinase is enzyme produced in small intestine helps in conversion of inactive trypsinogen into active trypsin which acts upon proteins in food and break downs.

question: If breast feeding is replaced by less nutritive food, low in proteins and calories, then the infants below the age of one year are likely to suffer from ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: If breast feeding is replaced by less nutritive food, low in proteins and calories, then the infants below the age of one year are likely to suffer from \underline{\phantom{a}} [\text{MHT-CET 2023}]
solution: Marasmus is always found in children below one year due to protein deficiency coupled with lower total food calorific value.

question: Succus entericus contains ___ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Succus entericus contains \underline{\phantom{a}} [\text{MHT-CET 2024}]
options: Mucus plus intestinal enzymes like dipeptides, lipases, disaccharides etc.
solution: Mucus plus intestinal enzymes together constitute intestinal juice or succus entericus. The intestinal juice contains various enzymes like dipeptides, lipases, disaccharides etc.

question: The upper surface of the tongue bears numerous projections called ___ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The upper surface of the tongue bears numerous projections called \underline{\phantom{a}} [\text{MHT-CET 2024}]
solution: The upper surface of the tongue bears numerous projections called papillae. Some papillae bear sensory receptors called taste buds.

question_latex: Complete the analogy with reference to product of digestion in human beings: Buccal cavity: x: Stomach: y
solution: In human, digestion food particles are mixed with saliva and forms a mass of food called bolus. At the end of gastric digestion, food is converted to a semifluid acidic mass of partially digested food is called chyme.

question: Given below are two statements. Statement-I : Parotid salivary glands are present below the tongue. Statement-II : Sublingual salivary glands are present in front of each ear. In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
question_latex: Given below are two statements. Statement-I : Parotid salivary glands are present below the tongue. Statement-II : Sublingual salivary glands are present in front of each ear. In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
options: A) Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
B) Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
C) Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
D) Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: B) Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
solution: Parotid glands are present in front of the ear. The submandibular glands are present below the lower jaw. The glands present below the tongue are called sublingual.

question: Rennin acts on ____
question_latex: Rennin acts on ____
solution: Rennin acts on milk protein - case. Rennin found in gastric juice of infants acts on casein, a protein present in milk. It brings about curling of milk proteins with the help of calcium.

question: Chief cells are found in ________ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Chief cells are found in ________ [\text{MHT-CET 2024}]
solution: (d) Mucus cells secrete mucus. Peptic or chief cells secrete proenzyme pepsinogen. Parietal cells secrete HCl and intrinsic factor which is essential for absorption of vitamin B12.

question: In which one of the following disorders, the digestion and absorption of food stops due to atrophy of digestive glands? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In which one of the following disorders, the digestion and absorption of food stops due to atrophy of digestive glands? [\text{MHT-CET 2024}]
solution: (c) It is a prolonged protein energy malnutrition (PEM) found in infants under one year of age. In this disease, protein deficiency is coupled with lower total food calorific value. Inadequate diet impairs physical growth and retards mental development, subcutaneous fat disappears, ribs become prominent, limbs become thin, skin becomes dry, thin and wrinkled, loss of weight, digestion and absorption of food stops due to atrophy of digestive glands. There is no oedema.

question: After mastication of starchy food, which of the following is formed? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: After mastication of starchy food, which of the following is formed? [\text{MHT-CET 2023}]
solution: (d) After mastication of starchy food is broken down into Maltose.

question: Kwashiorkor is caused due to prolonged deficiency mainly of ___________ in diet. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Kwashiorkor is caused due to prolonged deficiency mainly of \underline{\quad\quad\quad\quad} in diet. [\text{MHT-CET 2020}]
solution: (B) Kwashiorkor and Marasmus are PEM diseases i.e. protein energy malnutrition. They mainly occur due to prolonged deficiency of proteins.

question: Appendix is functional and helps in digestion of cellulose in _______ [MHT-CET 2024]

question: Absorption of alcohol takes place in ______ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Absorption of alcohol takes place in ______ [\text{MHT-CET 2024}]
solution: (a) Gastric mucosa is impermeable to most substances hence nutrients reach unabsorbed till small intestine. Little water, electrolytes, alcohol and drugs like aspirin get absorbed in stomach.
